metadata.title: Terraform CLI environment variables reference
metadata.description: Terraform environment variables let you customize the Terraform CLI's default behavior.  Learn about the Terraform CLI environment variables.

`)),mdx("p",null,`For more on how to use `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TF_VAR_name`),` in context, check out the section on `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/language/values/variables"},`Variable Configuration`),`.`),mdx("h2",{"id":"tf_cli_args-and-tf_cli_args_name"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#tf_cli_args-and-tf_cli_args_name","aria-label":"tf_cli_args and tf_cli_args_name permalink"},`\xbb`),`TF_CLI_ARGS and TF_CLI_ARGS_name`),mdx("a",{id:"tf-cli-args"}),mdx("p",null,`The value of `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TF_CLI_ARGS`),` will specify additional arguments to the
command-line. This allows easier automation in CI environments as well as
modifying default behavior of Terraform on your own system.`),mdx("p",null,`These arguments are inserted directly `,mdx("em",{parentName:"p"},`after`),` the subcommand
(such as `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`plan`),`) and `,mdx("em",{parentName:"p"},`before`),` any flags specified directly on the command-line.
This behavior ensures that flags on the command-line take precedence over
environment variables.`),mdx("p",null,`For example, the following command: `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TF_CLI_ARGS="-input=false" terraform apply -force`),`
is the equivalent to manually typing: `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`terraform apply -input=false -force`),`.`),mdx("p",null,`The flag `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TF_CLI_ARGS`),` affects all Terraform commands. If you specify a
named command in the form of `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TF_CLI_ARGS_name`),` then it will only affect
that command. As an example, to specify that only plans never refresh,
you can set `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TF_CLI_ARGS_plan="-refresh=false"`),`.`),mdx("p",null,`The value of the flag is parsed as if you typed it directly to the shell.

per-working-directory data, such as the current backend configuration.`),mdx("p",null,`By default this data is written into a `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`.terraform`),` subdirectory of the
current directory, but the path given in `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TF_DATA_DIR`),` will be used instead
if non-empty.`),mdx("p",null,`In most cases it should not be necessary to set this variable, but it may

`)),mdx("p",null,`Using this environment variable is recommended only for non-interactive usage, since in a local shell environment it can be easy to forget the variable is set and apply changes to the wrong state.`),mdx("p",null,`For more information regarding workspaces, check out the section on `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/language/state/workspaces"},`Using Workspaces`),`.`),mdx("h2",{"id":"tf_in_automation"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#tf_in_automation","aria-label":"tf_in_automation permalink"},`\xbb`),`TF_IN_AUTOMATION`),mdx("p",null,`If `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TF_IN_AUTOMATION`),` is set to any non-empty value, Terraform adjusts its
output to avoid suggesting specific commands to run next. This can make the
output more consistent and less confusing in workflows where users don't
directly execute Terraform commands, like in CI systems or other wrapping
applications.`),mdx("p",null,`This is a purely cosmetic change to Terraform's human-readable output, and the

`)),mdx("p",null,`Note that `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TERRAFORM_CONFIG`),` is a deprecated alias for the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TF_CLI_CONFIG_FILE`),` variable. We recommend using `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TF_CLI_CONFIG_FILE`),` instead of the deprecated `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TERRAFORM_CONFIG`),` variable.`),mdx("h2",{"id":"tf_plugin_cache_dir"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#tf_plugin_cache_dir","aria-label":"tf_plugin_cache_dir permalink"},`\xbb`),`TF_PLUGIN_CACHE_DIR`),mdx("p",null,`The `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TF_PLUGIN_CACHE_DIR`),` environment variable is an alternative way to set `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/cli/config/config-file#provider-plugin-cache"},`the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"a"},`plugin_cache_dir`),` setting in the CLI configuration`),`.`),mdx("p",null,`You can also use `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`TF_PLUGIN_CACHE_MAY_BREAK_DEPENDENCY_LOCK_FILE`),` to activate `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/cli/config/config-file#allowing-the-provider-plugin-cache-to-break-the-dependency-lock-file"},`the transitional compatibility setting `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"a"},`plugin_cache_may_break_dependency_lock_file`)),`.`),mdx("h2",{"id":"hcp-terraform-cli-integration"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#hcp-terraform-cli-integration","aria-label":"hcp terraform cli integration permalink"},`\xbb`),`HCP Terraform CLI Integration`),mdx("p",null,`The CLI integration with HCP Terraform lets you use HCP Terraform and Terraform Enterprise on the command line. The integration requires including a `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`cloud`),` block in your Terraform configuration. You can define its arguments directly in your configuration file or supply them through environment variables, which can be useful for non-interactive workflows like Continuous Integration (CI).`),mdx("p",null,`Refer to `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/cli/cloud/settings#environment-variables"},`HCP Terraform Settings`),` for a full list of `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`cloud`),` block environment variables.`))};MDXContent.isMDXComponent=true;

alertBanner.text: Terraform Cloud is now HCP Terraform
